text: The SUV parks. DANE PAYTON, (17), good-looking kid despit the pissed-off sneer, climbs out of the passenger door, stares at the house as if he’s looking at his own tomb.
Shit. LUCAS PAYTON, (10), eyes wide with excitement, scrambles of the back.
Dane just said shit. The boys’ Mom, SUSAN, (40), steps out of the driver’s doo

Don’t say shit, Dane. The words flow without emotion... like Susan’s said it a thousand times before. She wipes her hair from her pretty but tired face. And it’s more than the long drive... Susa is the face of a single mother chasing two boys.
You told us it wasn’t going to be that different than the last place.
It won’t be once we get our stuff moved in.
(slapping his neck) Except for the bugs, the heat, and the twelve-hundred mile walk to go hang out with my friends.
You'll make new friends. The bugs and heat... those are just a couple of the southern charms. Lucas grabs the house key from Susan, and charges to the front door.
I call biggest room. Susan follows after him. Dane stands there alone... staring... gazing up and down this very quiet street. Thi is a world away from New York.
Shit.
Lucas is already inside. Susan’s picking up a “Welcome Basket" from outside the door.
That was nice of someone. Dane approaches, carrying a suitcase and iPod.
What, Aunt Bee bake us a pie? Susan doesn’t bother to respond... doesn’t matter, becaus Dane wasn’t waiting around for her to... he walks inside.
Lucas stands in the doorway of a large, empty bedroom. Da steps in behind him.
This is so much cooler than the old place. I can put my bed over there, and desk by the window.
You can put your ass in that little room across the hall. Dane grabs a handful of Lucas’ shirt... tugs him out.
That one smells like potatoes.
Hold your breath. Lucas tries to push his way back into the room, but Dane easily stops him. Lucas knows the battle’s lost, so...
Mom, Dane said ass!
Don’t say ass, Dane. Dane slams the door... slides down to the floor against i This kid is miserable.

No furniture yet... just a few unpacked cardboard boxes scattered about. Dane sits on the floor, eating a slice o pizza out of the delivery box, and TEXTING AWAY on his ce phone. The THUMP of rap music tremors from his iPod. Lucas comes bouncing a basketball into the room.

There’s a goal in the street. Let’s go play. Dane doesn’t react... just keeps tapping his fingers on t keypad. LUCAS (cont'd) Dane. Still nothing. So Lucas bounces the ball off the top of Dane’s head.
Son of a... Dane jerks his earbuds out. DANE (cont’d) What’s your problem?
Let’s play some ball. Dane snatches the basketball... tosses it away... it roll out of the room.
Have fun.  Lucas watches Dane go back to his music and phone, then turns... stomps out... passes Susan in the doorway.

I‘1l play with you, Smooch. Lucas shakes his head... continues outside by himself. Su slides down to the floor beside Dane... grabs a slice of pizza, then tugs Dane’s earbud out of one ear. SUSAN (cont'd) It’s a change for Lucas too.
He’s happy anywhere he’s got a room to watch Spongebob or whatever.
Or for you to spend a little time with him.
Any more time and I’d kill him. Dane grabs another slice and stands to leave.
Let’s be happy here, okay? Dane fakes a big, pizza-stuffed smile, and walks out.

Moving truck in the driveway. Dane, Lucas and Susan joine in with the MOVERS, hauling furniture and boxes into the house. Dane pulls a CLOWN MASK from a box... slips it on, then l around the truck for Lucas to see. Lucas CRIES OUT... stumbles back through the boxes... falls to the yard.
Susan snatches the mask off Dane’s laughing face.
Why did you bring this?
(off Lucas) One guess. The little clown freak.
Shut up.
(mocking) Mom, Lucas just said shut up. Susan shoves the mask in her pocket.

You two are embarrassing yourselves in front of our new neighbor. Dane and Lucas glance beside them, to JULIE CAMPBELL, (17 southern small town Avril Lavigne, sitting on her front porch, stealing glances from the book in her lap. SUSAN (cont'd) (playfully nudges Dane) Beats old Mr. Hyatt hacking up phlegm from next door, huh? Dane ignores Susan... grabs a box... a BIG BOX, now that got an audience. He starts toward the house... glances ov and makes eye contact with Julie. He nods, she smiles... perfect start. Until...

Hey, Dane, where do you want me to put all your Clay Aiken cds? Dane’s face falls... he spins around... sees Lucas grinni Dane’s jaw clenches... he fights the urge to drop the box and go all “big brother” on Lucas. Instead, he just nods him... we’re not done here... then continues inside witho another glance to the smiling Julie.
(laughing) You’re in trouble now.
What’s new. Lucas loads up... starts up the walkway, veering wide to avoid Dane on his way back out. Dane just glares at him.
Take that in the basement, okay, sweetie? Lucas nods... continues inside.
Why do you baby him so much?

What’s the matter, you jealous? Susan playfully pinches Dane’s cheek. Dane pulls away. SUSAN (cont'd) I used to baby you before you got too cool for me. But if you want... Susan goes after Dane again. He dodges behind boxes.
Mom. Cut it out. God.
(tosses a pillow at him) What happened to my little boy? Dane glances over... sees that Julie is gone. So he SMACK Susan over the head with the pillow... there’s still a ki there somewhere.

Lucas flips on the light at the top of the stairs... bare enough light to see where he’s going, as he carries the b down the bare, scarred, wooden steps. He reaches the cement floor basement... all dust and shad Old tools and paint cans rest on metal shelves... boxes o dusty old notebooks and journals are piled in the corner. rusty freezer chest sits along the wall. Lucas stands at the center of the room, nervously glancin around. AND THEN A FAINT KNOCKING drifts from the back shadows of the room. Lucas squints back toward the sound.

Dane? The KNOCKING STOPS... the basement goes quiet... then SCRATCHING... FINGERNAILS OVER WOOD... and that’s more th enough for Lucas... he drops the box, and spins for the stairs... and RIGHT INTO A HULKING FIGURE. Lucas CRIES OUT... then realizes it’s just one of the MOV
You okay, buddy? Lucas manages a nod, then throws a last glance across th basement before he tears up the steps.
Dane carries more boxes up the front steps. Lucas charges outside to him.
Have you been downstairs yet?
Dude, look out, this crap’s heavy.
I heard something in the basement.

Probably the ghost of the old lady that lived here. Mom says she hung herself in that potato room you’re sleepin’ in. Lucas’ eyes go wide. Dane moves inside... doesn’t let Luc see his smile. Sometimes it’s fun to be the big brother. Lucas rushes down the walk to Susan.
What happened to the people that lived here before us?
I don’t know. Just moved someplace else I guess.
Dane said you told him the lady hung herself in my room. Susan looks at Dane, walking back out of the house. He grins... shrugs.
Coulda happened.
The only people getting hung in that house are you two if you both don’t cut it out. Susan carries a load of boxes past them to the house. Dan laughs at Lucas, who gives him a shove, and stomps off.
The windows are dark. No sign of movement.

Darker than dark... just shapes mixed with shadows. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas in bed... but he can’t sleep. He shifts... kicks... SNIFFS THE AIR of his potato room... scowls... pulls the blanket up over his nose. And then...

(soft and gurgling) Lucas. Lucas’ eyes flash open. VOICE (0.S.) (cont'd) Help me, Lucas. Lucas is afraid to breathe... finally rolls slowly over.. ...and sees the SHAPE OF A WOMAN HANGING IN HIS OPEN CLOS DOORWAY... feet swaying in the air. Lucas SCREAMS... hits the light switch beside his bed... .+.the room lights up, and we all see DANE, wearing Susan long coat like a dress, and hanging onto the top of the closet doorway with one hand... swinging... and now LAUGHING... hard. So hard that he drops to the floor.

(still laughing) Awesome scream, man... like a little girl’s. Susan comes racing into the room, half-asleep... sees Luc in bed... Dane on the floor in her coat... and her concer instantly turns to anger. She snaps her finger at Dane... points to the hall.

Out. Dane walks out, still laughing.  SUSAN (cont'd) And hang my coat back up. Susan waves for Lucas. SUSAN (cont'd) Come on. Lucas jumps out of bed. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/SUSAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Susan asleep... Lucas curled up beside her, safe and soun

Dane’s at the kitchen table, drowsily slurping up cereal. Lucas stands at the counter, gnawing on a still-frozen wa straight out of the box. Susan hurries in, slipping a sweater over her NURSE’S UNIFORM.
Okay, call me if there’s a problem, but I don’t want any problems, so don’t call me. I need this job to go well.
We'll be cool.
Promise me. Both of you.
Promise.
Scouts honor.
(kissing Dane on the head) You weren’t a Scout.
I thought about it once though because of the cookies.
(laughing) Those are Girl Scouts, loser. Susan kisses Lucas on the cheek.  10.
No pestering your brother.
Good luck, Mom.
Thanks, sweetie. And you two spend some time together today. Susan hurries out the door. Dane and Lucas just continue eating in silence.

Lucas walks down the hall... stops in Dane’s doorway... s him on his bed, listening to is iPod. Lucas keeps walking Lucas on his bedroom floor, playing with the hamster. Lucas in the living room, playing Xbox by himself. Dane walking out of the kitchen, eating a sandwich... pas Lucas without a word, as he enters to fix his own lunch. Lucas on his bed, tossing a baseball up toward the ceilin catching it in his glove... tossing it again. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Dane stands at his window, peering outside. Lucas steps i the doorway behind him, baseball glove still on.
Let’s go throw.
Busy.

Doin’ what? Dane doesn’t answer. Lucas walks in... looks out the window... and there’s Julie, sunbathing in her back yard. seventeen year-old boy’s dream. But not a ten year-old’s. Lucas grabs Dane’s glove... tri to shove it into his hand. LUCAS (cont'd) C'mon, you can stare at her from outside.  11.
(tosses the glove away) Back off. I don’t feel like it.
You never feel like it. Lucas stomps out. Dane doesn’t even notice he’s gone.

The back door swings open, and here comes Lucas striding INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Dane spots Lucas walking across the yard. Lucas throws a devious grin up at him as he walks toward Julie’s fence. Panic washes over Dane’s face... he knows that look. He t the window, shaking his head at Lucas.
Don’t do it. Lucas just keeps grinning... and walking.
Lucas reaches the fence... climbs up enough to lean over.
Hey! Julie raises up... squints over at Lucas... smiles.
Hi. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dane drops down to the floor beneath the window.

Shit. He waits as long as he can, then slowly inches up... peek back out the window... ...to Lucas pointing straight up at him, and Julie shield her eyes to get a better view of Dane.  12. Dane drops back down to the floor like a corpse... actual wishes he was dead right now... except he’s got one impor thing to do first. So he charges out of the room.
Lucas on the fence, in the middle of his chat with Julie.

Dane liked it better in Brooklyn. He wishes we hadn’t moved. But I... Suddenly the back door almost flies off its hinges as Dan explodes from the house... races toward Lucas on the fenc LUCAS (cont'd) I gotta go. Lucas leaps off the fence... sprints around the side of t house, with Dane in hot pursuit. LUCAS (cont'd)

She’s not here to save you this time! Lucas races to the SIDE BASEMENT DOOR... barges inside... tries to close it before Dane gets there, but he’s too late... BAM... Dane slams the door open. Lucas dodges aro the shelves... throws an old fishing rod at Dane as he ru DANE (cont'd) WHAT’S YOUR PROBLEM, DICKHEAD?

You shoulda played with me! Dane climbs over an old table to get to Lucas. Lucas back across the basement... into a metal shelf, TIPPING IT OVE Both boys freeze, as they watch the shelf tumble, spewing boxes and paint cans all over the place. A lamp SHATTERS. They stare at the wreckage, the fight suddenly stripped o of them.
Mom is gonna be pissed at you.
It was your fault.  13. They start grabbing boxes and cans... cleaning the mess. Dane lifts one end of the metal shelf.

Get that other side. Lucas grips the other edge... they tilt the shelf back upright. And when they do, they both see... ...the WOODEN TRAPDOOR IN THE CEMENT BASEMENT FLOOR. A tw foot square of scarred wood, with TWO PADLOCKS ON EACH SI securing it shut.
What is that? Dane shakes his head, no idea. He reaches down... gives i tug... locked. LUCAS (cont'd) That’s a lotta locks.
Probably gas pipes or something.
Or a treasure maybe. Dane rolls his eyes, then pulls on the door again, just i case. No good. So he stands up... starts searching the ar
Look for the keys. Lucas digs over the shelves. Dane spots a pair of PRUNING SHEARS... strains to cut through one of the locks. Not ev close. He tosses them away... jerks on the trap door agai

They’re not down here. Lucas steps back toward Dane, accidentally kicking one of FALLEN PAINT CANS as he moves... and we all hear the JING OF METAL from inside the can as it rolls. Dane and Lucas look at each other, then scramble after th can. Dane grabs it first... jerks out a RING OF KEYS. The exchange a grin, and Dane goes to work on the locks... searching and matching each key to its own lock... snappi them open one by one, until they’re all clear. The boys stare down at the trap door.  14. LUCAS (cont'd) If there’s treasure, I get half. They grip the handle together... Lucas’ little hand right beside Dane’s larger... pull the wooden door back on its hinges... ...revealing nothing but a SOLID BLACK HOLE. And this isn’t just a shallow niche in the floor... this deep... solid black... like staring into a hole in the universe. LUCAS (cont'd) It’s just a hole. Dane peers into the blackness, trying to get a better vie He reaches his hand in just a few inches, but the darknes swallows it like a black mouth. He jerks it back out.

It’s cold. Dane glances around the basement... spots a flashlight... grabs it, and switches it on. He crawls back to the hole. shines the light down. But again, the darkness overpowers the beam... chokes the life from it only a few feet down.

How deep do you think it is? Dane lifts a fallen nail from the floor beside them... dr it in. The nail sinks into the black... gone... not a sou The boys exchange a glance. Lucas crawls over the open tr door, dragging a PAINT CAN back across...

head_text.subj: ...WITHOUT NOTICING ALL THE SCRATCHES CLAWED ALONG THE IN

text: Lucas holds the can above the hole until Dane gives him a nod... he drops it... the can falls... disappears. They w for the clank that never comes.
Maybe it’s a real deep tunnel.
To where?  15. Dane shakes his head... no idea. Dane aims the flashlight again... they each lean their heads directly over the hol
.»..on the brothers’ faces peering in from opposite sides heads joined at the top.
There’s gotta be a bottom.
Hello!
»+.asS a grin spreads across Lucas’ face.
What?

...-the flashlight duct-taped around it, with a LONG STRI tied around his neck like a hangman’s noose. Dane and Lucas kneel beside the hole. Lucas holds the string, easing Cartman and the flashlight into the darkne

Screw you guys, I’m going home! The string slides over Lucas’ fingers... Cartman and the light descend further... a few feet down. CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont’d) I would never let a woman kick my ass. If she tries anything, I'd be like... And then the black just swallows Cartman, his voice, the light... everything just vanishes. Lucas quickly pulls the string, and the doll and flashlig appear from the darkness.  16. CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont'd) ...-back in the kitchen and make me some pie! Dane and Lucas exchange a smile. Lucas drops Cartman agai CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont'd) Yes, the fireman is very magical. If you... Then Cartman’s gone again.
How does it do that? Dane just shakes his head. Then suddenly, Lucas’ HAND JERKS... the string tugs... HARD... like a fish just hit baited hook.
What’d you do?
Nothin’. I think it got caught on something. Lucas winds the string back up... just a frayed end. Cart and the light are gone.

So you two didn’t kill each other? Lucas and Dane shoot up, startled by the voice... see Jul in the basement door, a long t-shirt that reads, “I’m Not Fairy-Tale Princess. Get Over It", hangs over her bikini. Dane stands up... steps between Julie and the hole.
Not yet.
She’s Julie. Dane nods hello.
And you’re Dane. The one that hates it here. Dane shoots Lucas a glare.
Do you wanna look at our hole?  17.
I’m sorry? Dane shoots Lucas a look... idiot.
Nothin’. There’s just a hole in the floor.

And that’s what people do for fun in Brooklyn? Julie walks around Dane toward Lucas. JULIE (cont'd) Play around with their holes? But then Julie sees the hole, and this is obviously not a normal hole. JULIE (cont'd) What is that?
(proudly) Our hole. Dane closes the basement door.
We're not sure what it is. Julie squints into the bottom. Lucas pulls another flashlight from a box... hands it to Julie. She shines th flashlight into the black.
We can’t see the bottom. Julie sticks one of her bare feet down into the darkness, Dane grabs her.
I wouldn’t do that.
It’s just a crawlspace or something. But then Lucas rolls another paint can into the hole... J watches it vanish without a sound.  18. JULIE (cont'd) That’s really weird.

Yeah. Dane glances around the basement... spots the OLD FISHING ROD. He lifts it... stretches out the lure-ended line... knots it around the metal handle of another paint can, th holds the can over the hole. Lucas and Julie watch intently, as Dane releases the reel clasp... the can drops... the line WHIZZES OUT... the ree spins like a motor, faster and faster... the fishing line unwinding at a dizzying pace... growing thinner and thinn on the spool... .--and Dane, Lucas and Julie are all just watching the re spin... the line pull, as the weighted can drags it out.. until finally, the last of the fishing line unravels from spool... disappears into the hole.
O-kay. Lucas has a smile spread across his face.
This is so cool.
Maybe it’s one of those sinkholes... like in California or wherever when the streets open up and the cars drop into them.
(thinks of something) Hang on. Dane takes off for the stairs. Lucas and Julie look back the hole... exchange a glance, then race after him.
Wait up, Dane!

head_text.subj: THE VIEWFINDER OF A VIDEO CAMERA...

text: ...with Julie’s face filling the frame.  19.

Is it working? And then we see Dane holding the camera. There’s a rope t around it. He SWITCHES ON THE CAMERA LIGHT, then gently lowers the camera down into the depths. And just like with everything else, the blackness swallow the camera. Dane lets the rope slip across his fingers... easing the camera deeper... deeper... until finally, he stops... hol it secure. JULIE (cont'd) What do you think you’re gonna see?
Whatever’s down there. Dane slowly twists the rope, turning the camera in a circ
There’s nothing down there. It’s a hole.
Maybe it’s like an underground tomb... the Catacombs or something.
The Catacombs of Bensonville. I doubt it.
I say it’s a treasure. Dane twists and pulls the rope, working to get every angl with the camera.

That’s good. Let’s go watch it. See what the inside of a hole looks like. Dane nods... pulls the rope up, until the camera reappear out of the hole. He slams the trap door closed, and they charge up the stairs.  20.
Dane, Lucas and Julie are all squatted on the floor in fr of the television, staring at the black screen. Dane’s go the video camera in his lap... the cables running to the
I told you. There’s nothing down there. It’s just a hole.
A hole with no bottom in the basement of a house. How does that make sense? And why are there a buncha locks on it?
To keep kids like us from fallin’ in? Julie nods to Dane. But then a WHISP OF MOVEMENT on the screen.
Did you see that? Dane rewinds the video... replays it... a BLURRED SHAPE FLASHES PAST. DANE (cont’d) Right there. Dane rewinds... plays... pauses on the dim mass. DANE (cont’d) That’s something.

And anything. Light coming through a crack in the wall. The front door opens behind them... Susan’s home. The kid all jump to their feet, spinning to her... .-.and DON’T SEE THE DIM IMAGE OF A HUMAN FACE APPEAR ON SCREEN, ITS MOUTH STRETCHED OPEN INHUMANLY WIDE.
Hey, guys.
Hi, Mom. We were just watching tv.  21. Behind the kids, the ONSCREEN FACE SEEMS TO TURN TOWARD T VOICES... STARE OUT AT THEM.
(off the image) Yeah. What is that? The face drifts out of view, before Dane spins back to tu it off... only blackness again.
Some stupid show. We were getting ready to turn it off. And this is Julie... from next door.
Hi.
Hey, Julie. (holds up a bag) I brought plenty of Chinese if you're hungry.
Thank you, but I better go. My mom’s probably looking for me. (to Dane) I’ll see you later.
Yeah... cool. Julie starts for the door.
(to Susan) It was nice meeting you.
You too, Julie. Julie leaves. Susan starts for the kitchen. SUSAN (cont'd) So what did you guys do all day?
We found this sweet... Dane throws his hand over Lucas’ mouth... shakes his head
Just hung out. How was the new job?  22.

Good. Susan throws a shocked look back at Dane. SUSAN (cont'd) Did you really just ask a question about my life? Wow... a couple days in the South, and look how polite you are. Dane fakes a laugh... they continue into the kitchen.
TIGHT ON THE TRAP DOOR... the locks resting beside it. Th the door BEGINS TO INCH SLOWLY OPEN. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane in bed, eyes closed... looking asleep, but...
We could get a ladder and climb down. ...there’s Lucas sprawled under a blanket on the floor, w awake... excited.
There’s no ladder that long.
Like one of those fire truck ladders. Or we tie a rope around somebody... drop ‘em down there.
We’re not droppin’ anybody in the hole, dude. Now go to sleep. (beat) And remember, don’t tell Mom. It'll just freak her out, and she won’t let us figure out what it is.
What if the guy that lived here before was a bank robber, and he hid like a hundred million dollars down there. We could get it... buy whatever we wanted.  23.
(exhausted) Dude... shut up.
Mom wouldn’t have to work anymore. We could move back to our old house. Dane’s eyes suddenly open... that does sound good.

We’1l check it out again tomorrow. Now go to sleep or go back to your own room. Lucas closes his eyes... smiles at all the possibilities bouncing around in his head. INT. JULIE'S HOUSE/JULIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Julie’s propped up in her bed, listening to her iPod as s reads. And we can hear the music too... until Julie’s lam FLICKERS OFF... her music goes silent. Julie glances around... flicks the lamp switch... taps th iPod... nothing. And then somewhere, a LITTLE GIRL GIGGLES. Julie’s eyes s the room... then from BELOW HER...
You can’t find me. Julie stops breathing... sits there frozen... just her ey rolling down to the edge of the bed... toward the floor. holds back as long as she can, then leans over.

.--gliding over the edge of the bed... to the floor... em JULIE SLOWLY LEANS FURTHER... her head almost touching th ground as she stretches to see under the bed... closer... closer... the shadowy boxes and dirty clothes coming into view... ...-when JULIE'S iPOD SUDDENLY BLASTS BACK ON. Julie jerk with a start... rolls off the bed... hits the floor with THUD... the LAMP FLICKERS BACK ON...  24. -..and Julie sees there’s no one under her bed. She rolls her eyes, almost embarrassed, then climbs back
Susan, dressed for work, walks toward her car. Dane and Lucas stand at the front door, waving goodbye, and itchin get her out of here so they can slam the door shut, and g down to the hole.
If there's a problem, the hospital number’s by the phone.
But you don’t want any problems. Got it.
And there’s plenty of food in the fridge. Make sure you eat some fruit. No more Cool Whip and chocolate sauce.
You told us that already.
Five times. Susan starts to climb in... the boys start to shut the door... until Susan steps back out again.
And be nice to each other.
Promise! Susan waves again... finally backs out of the drive... pu away. The boys stand waving until she disappears, then WHAM... the door SLAMS SHUT.

Lucas and Dane rush around the room, grabbing rope... an extra flashlight. And then Dane freezes... because Julie is standing at the back door in her bikini, waving in at him. She cracks the door, and leans in.  25.

Some people are hangin’ out at my place, if you wanna come over? (off Dane’s rope and flashlight) Unless you've got hole business. Dane’s frozen... except for his eyes, bouncing from Julie her bikini to Lucas, already at the basement door, VIOLEN SHAKING HIS HEAD.
(to Lucas) Dude.
Dane trots out the back door toward Julie’s, wearing shor with a towel tossed over his shoulder. Lucas stands at th door, ready to explode.
That hole’s not going anywhere.
Neither is she.

Can’t take the chance. And don’t go down there till I get back. Lucas watches Dane jump the fence into Julie’s yard... jo a group of other TEENS. And Lucas is left alone... again. He walks back into the house... slams the door shut.

From the bottom of the steps, we watch as the basement do drifts open... and there’s Lucas filling the doorway. He stares down the steps, deciding whether to descend or not finally does, pulling the door closed behind him.

Lucas fits the keys into the locks... pops them open... l them off to the side. He grabs the handle of the trap door... hesitates a beat before he lifts it, pulling the square of wood back... revealing that coal black hole.
Kids splashing and playing. Dane and Julie trying to dunk each other under water.
Lucas props a hand against the edge, and leans directly o over the hole... gazes down into the emptiness, then lets thick gob of spit fall from his lips. It hits the black and immediately vanishes.
.--looking back up at Lucas.
The party’s still rocking. Dane and Julie lie side by sid on blankets, soaking up the rays.
Lucas slides down to his stomach... nervously reaches his hand into the darkness of the hole. He senses something a pulls it back out, then builds up his nerve again... stretching deeper... deeper...
.+..as Lucas’ hand reaches down toward us. Our POV starts gliding up... floating toward Lucas and his hand.
...reaching down as far as he can into the hole... just a the UPSTAIRS DOOR SWINGS OPEN.

Hey, Mucas! Lucas jerks his arm up in a panic... grabs the trap door, eases it back shut. DANE (0.S.) (cont'd) You down there? Lucas darts toward the outside basement door... eases it open, and slips out... just as Dane moves a few steps dow the stairs... peers into the empty basement... sees the closed trap door... walks back up the stairs.
Dane rises from the basement, just as Lucas strolls in th front door.
Where’ve you been?
Outside... playin’ basketball.
Well c’mon, we’re gonna go grab some ice cream. Lucas sees Julie waiting at the back door.
What about the hole?
We’1l check it out when we get back. Hurry up. Lucas GRUNTS... follows Dane outside.

Dane and Julie sitting at a table, laughing together as t work on a couple double dip cones. A few tables away, Lucas sits alone, letting his ice crea melt in the sun, as he draws a picture on a napkin...  28. of Dane and Julie, with goofy, oversized lips puckered against each other, and a giant-headed monster standing o them, mouth gaping, ready to swallow them both. As Dane laughs, he glances past Julie... spots something the distance... a FIGURE... too far away to recognize, bu seems to be just watching them. Dane’s smile fades. Julie notices it.
What is it? Dane snaps out of his stare... looks at Julie and shakes head... then squints back toward the figure... GONE.
Nothing.
Lucas charges through the fence from Julie’s house, with walking behind him.
Hurry! We can mess with it some more before Mom gets home. Dane just keeps striding behind him.
Lucas races inside... sees Susan reading on the couch.

Hey, smooch. Lucas’ shoulders fall. Susan walks to him. SUSAN (cont'd) Don’t act so excited to see me. Dane enters, as Susan plants a kiss on Lucas’ cheek... wi Lucas glaring up at Dane. Dane shrugs. SUSAN (cont'd) What happened to you two?
Dane made me go get ice cream so he could flirt with his new girlfriend.  29.
We just hung out with Julie for a little while.
All day. Lucas walks for the stairs... gives the basement door a k as he goes past.
I grabbed a pizza if you’re hungry?
I’m not. Lucas just disappears up the stairs.
What’s the matter with him?
I don’t know. Tired I guess. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - EVENING Lucas falls onto his bed... grabs a HANDHELD VIDEO GAME.. starts tapping the buttons.
Dark and quiet. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas still dressed, asleep on the bed, video game still his hand. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane sleeping... until...
(whisper) Boy... Dane’s eyes flash open... dart around.

Lucas.  30. Dane glances around the room... his eyes drift to the closet... the door standing open, revealing all that dark inside. Dane stares at it a beat, then stands... walks ov and closes the door.

.»»-on Dane inside the room, pushing the closet door clos as THE FIGURE OF A MAN PASSES DOWN THE HALL... and Dane n saw him. Dane walks away from the closet door... toward the hall.. steps out, and we’re just waiting for whoever that was to grab Dane... but nothing happens. And Dane moves halfway down the down the hall... into the bathroom... to the sink... turns on the water, and sticks head under to gulp it back. He twists the faucet back off the house is eerily silent. Dane walks back out into the hall... down the hallway to room... and again we’re just waiting for that man to leap from the shadows... but no. And Dane moves back into the room. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’ ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dane climbs back into his bed... gets comfortable... then SEES SOMETHING... «..THE CLOSET DOOR IS OPEN AGAIN. Dane stares at it, confused... even a little nervous. He stares at that deep, dark rectangle of black emptiness staring back at him... hiding everything it holds.

Lucas. I know you’re in there. Dane rises out from under the blanket... eases toward the closet... nearer... closer... almost there, as he reaches for the door... gets his hands on it to slam it back clos then...
